Following is a description of the components of the multidisciplinary evaluation which the district proposes to conduct

Los padres de niños con discapacidades tienen derechos que están protegidos bajo las garantías de procedimiento de la la Ley para Individuos con Discapacidades (IDEA -Individuals with Disabilities Act). Una copia de sus derechos como padres se encuentra adjunta. Si tiene alguna pregunta sobre esta notificación o sobre sus derechos, usted puede contactar a

Parents of children with disabilities have rights which are protected under the procedural safeguards of the Individuals with Disabilities Act (IDEA). A copy of your parental rights is enclosed. If you have any questions regarding this notice or your rights you may contact

Records for your child are no longer needed to provide educational services to your child when five (5) years has passed since the record was last created or revised and your child has moved to the next building level except records designated in Board policy as a permanent individual record, and is subject to destruction once that period is elapsed.
